thread.title: Reliance Jio crosses 100 million users in 170 days
thread.title_full: Reliance Jio crosses 100 million users in 170 days

title: Reliance Jio crosses 100 million users in 170 days
text:
Reliance Jio crosses 100 million users in 170 days Reliance Jio crosses 100 million users in 170 days By February 21, 2017 “Jio has officially crossed 100 million users within just six months of launch” 
Reliance Jio commenced its commercial operations in September last year. Today in a live streamed event, Mukesh Ambani announced that Jio has crossed the 100 million subscribers milestone in just 170 days. The emerging telecom operator added seven customers every second. 
Ambani claims that India is now the number one country in the world for mobile data usage. Jio users consumed 100 crore GB of data last month, the same as mobile broadband users in the US. Per day, Jio users streamed 5.5 crore hours of video and made 200 crore minutes worth of voice and video calls. 
As promised earlier, Jio will continue to offer unlimited free local, STD and roaming calls to any network for life. Jio promises to match the best-selling tariff plan of any telecom operator in the country, and offer 20 percent more mobile data to boot. Lastly, Ambani also announced that by the end of 2017, Jio will cover all cities, towns and villages in India, serving to 99 percent of the country’s population. Facebook Comments
